sentences.cn: 反感,厌恶一种强烈的反感或厌恶感.

sentences.en: All of that is of the utmost repugnance.
sentences.cn: 这种事叫人恶心到极点.

sentences.en: But today, that repugnance to monotheism is not a laughing matter.
sentences.cn: 然而,今天人对一神论的厌恶不再只是嘲笑那样简单了.

sentences.en: He fought down a feelings of repugnance.
He had a repugnance of all things to do with commerce.
sentences.cn: 他厌恶与商业有关的一切事务.

sentences.en: He has a great repugnance to writing letters.
I cannot overcome my repugnance to eating snails.
sentences.cn: 吃蜗牛真恶心,我可受不了.

sentences.en: If we gave the least expression to our natural repugnance for this meal, no sense of responsibility for our health could prompt him to press it on us a second time.
sentences.cn: 如果我们稍稍流露出一点对于这顿早餐的自然的厌恶表情，那么即便他有为我们的健康负责的责任感，也不会使他一再地勉强我们吞咽下去的。

sentences.en: Otherwise, does not speak the principle, a rage sips the vinegar, must annoy the repugnance.
sentences.cn: 反之, 毫不讲理, 大发雷霆地呷醋, 必惹反感.

sentences.en: She felt a deep sense of shame and repugnance.
She had a repugnance to the person with whom she spoke.
sentences.cn: 她看不惯这个和她谈话的人.

sentences.en: She have a deep repugnance to the idea of accepting charity.
sentences.cn: 她认为接受救济的想法是要不得的.

sentences.en: She turned away from him in repugnance.
sentences.cn: 她极为厌恶地从他面前转身走开了.

sentences.en: She was trying to overcome her physical repugnance for him.
sentences.cn: 她努力克制对他非常强烈的反感。

sentences.en: Tears of anger and repugnance began to hang from my eyes.
sentences.cn: 愤怒和厌恶使我眼眶里涌出了泪水.

sentences.en: The woman tried to fight down a feeling of repugnance to speak to her ex-husband.
sentences.cn: 那女人努力抑制反感来跟她前夫说话。

sentences.en: To die is only to be as we were born; yet no one feels any remorse, or regret, or repugnance, in contemplating this last idea.
sentences.cn: 死亡只是恢复诞生前的原状而已；在想到诞生前的情形时，我们都毫无悔恨、遗憾、或厌恶之感。
